borscht.title: Borscht
borscht.description: A hearty and flavorful beet soup, perfect for any season.

ingredients: Pork small ribs or pork meat with bone
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Prepare the Meat: Cut pork meat into 2cm pieces (if not using ribs). Place the meat or ribs in a large pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil. Simmer for 1-1.5 hours until tender. If using meat with bone, remove the bones after boiling.

Prepare Vegetables: While the meat is cooking, peel and prepare the vegetables. Grate half of the beets and cut the other half into thin strips. Cut the potatoes into large chunks. Finely chop the onion. Grate half of the carrot and cut the remaining half into thin strips. Thinly slice the cabbage.

Cook the 'Zazharka' (Fry-up): Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and fry until golden. Add the carrots and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the beets and continue to fry. After about 10 minutes, stir in the tomato paste, sugar, and vinegar. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Combine the Soup: Add the potatoes directly to the pot with the boiling meat. Add the entire beet and carrot 'zazharka' mixture to the pot. Add the sliced cabbage to the soup.
Simmer: Bring the soup to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low. Let it simmer gently for about 40 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Finish and Serve: Turn off the heat. Stir in the fresh chopped parsley, salt, and pepper to your liking. For the best taste, let it rest for at least 20-30 minutes before serving.
recipe.servingSuggestion: Serve hot with a side of black bread, fresh garlic cloves for rubbing on the bread, and chopped spring onions. Most importantly, add a generous dollop of sour cream or Greek yogurt to each bowl.
recipe.proTip: Like many stews, Borscht is even better the next day!

ingredients: A few drops of almond essence (optional)
instructions: Cake: Preheat the oven to 180째C (350째F). In a bowl, mix together the oatmeal and flour.
In another bowl, cream the butter. Add the sugar, unbeaten egg whites, and (optionally) the almond essence. Mix well.
Add the oatmeal-flour mixture to the butter mixture and combine until you have a smooth dough.
Grease a baking pan and sprinkle with breadcrumbs.
Spread the dough in a thin layer over the bottom of the baking pan.
Bake the cake for 15-20 minutes at 180째C (350째F), or until light brown and cooked through. Let it cool.
Buttercream: In a saucepan, bring the milk and 100g of sugar to a boil.
In a small bowl, mix the cocoa and pudding powder (or cornstarch) with a splash of cold milk to a smooth paste.
Pour the paste into the boiling milk and, stirring constantly, cook for a moment until the pudding thickens.
In a bowl, cream the 200g of butter. Add the icing sugar and mix well.
Add the cooled pudding to the butter, one spoonful at a time, while continuing to mix, until you have a smooth buttercream.
Finishing: Spread the buttercream over the cooled cake and garnish with chocolate shavings.
recipe.servingSuggestion: Perfect with a cup of coffee or tea.
recipe.proTip: You can make the cake and buttercream a day in advance. Assemble the cake on the day of serving for the best taste.
